Topic 1        Dynasties and rulers

1.    “The power and effectiveness of a ruler does not depend on their military power.” With reference to
      either William I or Frederick I, to what extent do you agree with this statement?


2.    Assess the sources of, and reasons for, the development of law codes in medieval Europe or the
      Islamic world.


3.    Assess the reasons clerics and the middle class played an important role in medieval European
      bureaucracies.


4.    Evaluate the success of Harun al-Rashid (786–809) in maintaining political authority in the Abbasid
      empire.


5.    Examine the role of religious ideology in supporting the Fatimid dynasty’s claim to rule.


6.    Discuss the role and importance of officials in medieval Islamic states.



Topic 2        Society and economy

7.    “Women were a crucial but often overlooked component of medieval European society.” To what
      extent do you agree with this statement?


8.    Analyse the reasons for the development and growth of towns in medieval Europe.


9.    Assess the extent to which changes to the manorial system were caused by the growth of
      urban centres.


10.   Analyse to what extent the economy of the Islamic world was determined by geography and the
      physical environment.


11.   Examine the socio-economic roles played by families and kinship connections in the Islamic world.


12.   Assess the degree to which cities in the Islamic world were dependent on the rural economy to
      support them.

Topic 3        Wars and warfare

13.   “Religion was rarely the cause of wars in medieval Europe.” To what extent do you agree with this
      statement?


14.   Analyse the role of women in warfare.


15.   “Western military tactics were the most important reason for sucess in the First Crusade.” To what
      extent do you agree with this statement?


16.   “The battle of Manzikert (1071) was a key turning point in Islamic history.” To what extent do you
      agree with this statement?


17.   Examine the reasons why the concept of holy war became so important in either medieval Europe
      or the Islamic world.


18.   “The reasons for the civil war (fitna) from 656 to 661 in Islamic history were non-religious.” To what
      extent do you agree with this statement?



Topic 4        Intellectual, cultural and artistic developments

19.   Assess the reasons for, and the results of, the establishment of universities in medieval Europe.


20.   Discuss the reasons for, and the results of, the increase in the number of books and other written
      materials in medieval Europe.


21.   Assess the social and economic roles of cathedrals and churches in medieval Europe.


22.   Assess the religious and non-religious importance of pilgrimage in the Islamic world.


23.   Assess the extent to which great congregational mosques of medieval Islam were more than simply
      places of prayer.


24.   “Islam supported and suppressed scientific learning.” To what extent do you agree with this
      statement?

Topic 5        Religion and the state

25.   “Sufism was more closely linked to holy men than to religious institutions in the medieval period.”
      To what extent do you agree with this statement?


26.   Assess the reasons for, and the consequences of, the breakdown in the relations between Henry II and
      Thomas Becket.


27.   With reference to one religious opposition movement in medieval Europe, examine the reasons for its
      growth and for its defeat.


28.   “The reasons for anti-Semitism in medieval Europe were not religious in nature.” To what extent do
      you agree with this statement?


29.   Discuss the reasons why the Kharijites did not attract more support from other Muslims.


30.   Assess the main consequences of the Sunni/Shia division in the medieval Islamic world.
